problem_text:
Let F be a non-abelian finitely generated free group, 1 ̸= w ∈ F, and n ⩾ 1. Is the group ⟨F, t | t^n = w⟩ linear of degree 2 over a field of characteristic 0 if w is not a proper power in F?
This question is motivated by the following well-known question: is it true that the free Q-group F^Q is linear over a field? (See 13.39(b).)
A. Jaikin-Zapirain
